contextId.occurrenceNote: Paul compares suffering for Christ Jesus to the suffering that a good soldier endures. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: as a good soldier of Christ Jesus

contextId.occurrenceNote: Cancer quickly spreads in a person's body and destroys it. This is a metaphor that means what those people were saying would spread from person to person and harm the faith of those who heard it. Alternate translation: "What they say will spread like an infectious disease" or "Their talk will spread quickly and cause destruction like cancer" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.quote: ὁ λόγος αὐτῶν ὡς γάγγραινα νομὴν ἕξει
contextId.glQuote: Their talk will spread like cancer
